intro: Parabaena sagittata, commonly known as the arrowleaf parabaena, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, hollow stems and trifoliate leaves with a distinctive arrowhead shape. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Parabaena sagittata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in swampy areas and along stream banks.
